intro: Gymnostachyum simplicicaule, commonly known as the simple-stemmed gymnostachyum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and ixora plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. Gymnostachyum simplicicaule is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
